intro: Annona axilliflora, commonly known as the Mexican custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape with a smooth margin. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in axillary inflorescences, which are located in the leaf axils. The fruit is a rough, green to yellowish berry that ripens to a yellow or orange color and is edible when fully mature.
